vectorData.altText: 9. Identify the class of tissue. Be specific.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
That’s right! Cardiac muscle tissue in cross section can be identified by i) the position of the nuclei in the centre of the cells and ii) the irregular shape of the cells.
This is a cross section of cardiac muscle. Notice the centrally-placed nuclei, the more proportionate size of the cells and nuclei, and the irregular shape of the cells.

N = nucleus   
I = intercalated disc  
S = striations
This is a longitudinal section of cardiac muscle. Notice the mononucleate, branching cells, the striations and the intercalated discs.
